body:
@Merovius The context example i not a very good one imho: The general claim of go 1 is that the language and standard library remains stable - not only compatible with the previous version, we don't introduce new libraries, keywords etc. I read the argument very often: This cannot go to the standard library because, the standard library is like it is. And this is a good thing - ask Swift developers about it. 
Context is the one and only exception - and i hope it will be. And because it's the standard library vendoring for example there is not a real option: I get that. But i doubt that one change to the standard library is justification enough for the alias declarations - they will be around forever with all it's implications.
